thread.title: CyberPower Appointed to CABA Board of Directors

author: cnbc.com
title: CyberPower Appointed to CABA Board of Directors

organizations.name: caba board of directors daniel niewirowicz

text:
Daniel Niewirowicz represents power-protection leader with key building-automation group
SHAKOPEE, Minn.--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Cyber Power Systems (USA), Inc. , a leader in power protection and management products, announced today that it has joined the Board of Directors of the Continental Automated Buildings Association (CABA) , naming Daniel Niewirowicz, special projects group leader at CyberPower, as its representative. CABA is a global trade association that promotes advanced technologies for integrated systems and the automation of homes and buildings.
“I am honored to be appointed to the CABA Board,” Niewirowicz said. “CABA offers the industry tremendous value through its rich portfolio of research and industry networking services and I am gratified to contribute to its efforts.” Niewirowicz leads strategic product development, automation and the Internet of Things (IoT) at CyberPower and is responsible for development of power-management solutions across the critical data path from the data center to edge devices for building automation.
“We are thrilled to have a voice on the CABA Board, one of the most active and respected trade organizations in the building-controls industry,” said Brent Lovett, general manager and president of CyberPower. “Our participation gives us insight into our development of solutions which address the growing need for power protection of critical building and controller equipment.”
"The expertise and passion of our Board puts CABA in an incredibly strong position,” said Ronald J. Zimmer, CABA president and CEO. “We are consequently excited to have the opportunity to work with CyberPower to advance our shared goals for a strengthened home and building systems industry.”
Niewirowicz brings 30 years of experience in the built-environment sector to the CABA Board. From building envelope to the latest smart facility integrations, he is an expert in electromechanical systems and has managed multi-million-dollar mechanical-electrical-plumbing (MEP) projects in educational, medical and commercial environments.
About Cyber Power Systems (USA), Inc.
CyberPower designs and manufactures uninterruptible power supply systems, power distribution units, surge protectors, remote management hardware, power management software, mobile chargers and connectivity products. The company serves customers in enterprise, corporate, government, education, healthcare and small office/home office environments. CyberPower products are available through authorized distributors and sold by value-added resellers, system integrators, managed service providers, select retailers and online resellers. For more information, visit: https://www.cyberpowersystems.com/ .
About CABA
The Continental Automated Buildings Association (CABA) is an international not-for-profit industry association dedicated to the advancement of intelligent home and intelligent building technologies. The organization is supported by an international membership of over 330 organizations involved in the design, manufacture, installation and retailing of products relating to home automation and building automation. Public organizations, including utilities and government are also members. CABA’s mandate includes providing its members with networking and market research opportunities. CABA also encourages the development of industry standards and protocols, and leads cross-industry initiatives. More information is available at https://www.caba.org/ .
